creator: rimovm@centercomp.com
text:
It seems that if a context is listed in server.xml  Example:

<Context path="" docBase="rewards" debug="0" reloadable="true"/>

Then my servlets that get loaded on startup as defined in the web.xml for the 
webapp get loaded twice. 

Thanks for looking into this.

-Mike

Can you provide a web app that illustrates this?

The reason I ask is that the "examples" web app included with Tomcat is set up
exactly this way, but the load-on-startup servlets are executed only once.

remm@apache.org
text:
The problem here is that the webapp will actually be loaded twice:
- once as explicitely defined
- once automatically loaded, and mapped as "/rewards"

I don't think this is really a bug, as I'm a bit worried about making the auto 
deploy feature too intelligent (which would make it less predictable).
Instead, I would suggest to put the webapp outside of the auto-deploy path.

This can be reproduced very easily, by adding
          <Context path="" docBase="webdav" debug="0"/>
in server.xml.

This webapp will then be deployed twice (once as the root webapp, once as 
the "webdav" webapp), and the "ROOT" webapp itself won't get deployed.

As explained, the behavior implemented looks consistent (although it may not be
